body_content.explanation: a period of seven days, especially either from Monday to Sunday or from Sunday to Saturday:
examples: We go to the cinema about once a week.
Will you be going to next week's class?
It usually takes about four weeks to get the forms processed.
Don't do anything strenuous for a week or two.
It'll be weeks (= several weeks) before the flood damage is cleaned up.

body_content.explanation: the five days from Monday to Friday, the usual working period for many people:
examples: We're usually too tired to go out much during the week.

body_content.explanation: one week after the day mentioned:
examples: The first performance of the play is a week (from) today/tomorrow.
Our holiday starts a week on Saturday.
She has to go back to see the doctor Friday week.

body_content.explanation: one week before the day mentioned:
examples: It was his birthday a week ago last Friday.
The problems with the TV started a week last Monday.

body_content.explanation: the amount of hours spent working during a week or the number of days on which a person works:
examples: A lot of farm workers work a six-day week.

body_content.explanation: each week during a period of time:
examples: We could see his health deteriorate week by week.

body_content.explanation: regularly or continuously for many weeks:
examples: I go to aerobics three times a week, week in, week out.
